p: Invasive plants can spread across diverse habitats via individual plasticity (Williams, Mack, & Black, 1995). When dispersed in a shaded environment with low light intensities, invasive plants frequently develop a greater leaf area and biomass to enhance their light capture and utilization efficiency to adapt to the reduced light conditions (Du et al., 2017). This phenomenon reveals that plants have developed some regulatory processes to adapt to shade conditions and may enable their invasion into wider areas.
